get.description: Retrieves detailed information about the current authenticated user session, including project details, organization membership, and API key information if applicable. This endpoint is useful for verifying authentication status and retrieving contextual information about the authenticated user and their access privileges.

200.description: Session is valid and active. Returns detailed information about the authenticated user, their project, and organization.

auto_id.description: Internal auto-incrementing ID for the project

id.description: UUID identifier for the project

org_id.description: Organization UUID that this project belongs to

email.description: Email address used for project notifications

nano_id.description: Short, URL-friendly unique identifier for the project

created_at.description: Date and time when the project was created

updated_at.description: Date and time when the project was last modified

webhook_url.description: Endpoint URL for trigger webhook notifications

event_webhook_url.description: Endpoint URL for event webhook notifications

webhook_secret.description: Secret used to verify webhook signatures

triggers_enabled.description: Flag indicating if triggers are enabled for this project

last_subscribed_at.description: Date and time when the project last subscribed to updates

deleted.description: Flag indicating if the project has been deleted

is_new_webhook.description: Deprecated: Please refer to webhook_version instead. True indicates if the webhook configuration is using the previous new format (V2). False indicates the oldest format (V1)

id.description: Short, URL-friendly unique identifier for the organization

project.description: Details of the current active project (null if accessing with org-level credentials)

name.description: User-defined name for the API key

org_member_id.description: UUID identifier for the organization member who owns this API key

deleted_at.description: Date and time when the API key was deleted (if applicable)

key.description: The actual API key value (usually only shown once during creation)

id.description: UUID identifier for the organization member

name.description: Display name of the authenticated user

role.description: Access role of the authenticated user within the organization

delete.description: Soft-deletes a connected account by marking it as deleted in the database. This prevents the account from being used for API calls but preserves the record for audit purposes.

parameters.name: nanoid

200.description: Successfully deleted the connected account. The account is marked as deleted but retained in the database for historical purposes.

success.description: Indicates whether the connected account was successfully deleted

schema.description: Response returned after successfully deleting a connected account

patch.summary: Enable or disable a connected account
patch.description: Updates the status of a connected account to either enabled (active) or disabled (inactive). Disabled accounts cannot be used for API calls but remain in the database.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the connected account
parameters.name: nanoId

enabled.description: Set to true to enable the account or false to disable it

200.description: Successfully updated the connected account status. If enabled=true, the account status is set to ACTIVE; if enabled=false, the status is set to INACTIVE.

success.description: Indicates whether the connected account status was successfully updated

schema.description: Response returned after successfully updating a connected account status

400.description: Bad request - Invalid nanoid format or invalid request body

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication failed

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to update this connected account

404.description: Connected account not found - The specified account does not exist or has been deleted

500.description: Internal server error - Failed to update the connected account status due to a server-side issue

post.summary: Refresh authentication for a connected account
post.description: Initiates a new authentication flow for a connected account when credentials have expired or become invalid. This may generate a new authentication URL for OAuth flows or refresh tokens for other auth schemes.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the connected account
parameters.name: nanoid

validate_credentials.description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Whether to validate the provided credentials, validates only for API Key Auth scheme

200.description: Successfully refreshed the connected account authentication. For OAuth flows, a new redirect URL is provided.

id.description: The unique identifier of the connected account

status.description: The current status of the connected account (e.g., active, pending, failed)

redirect_url.description: The URL to which the user should be redirected to complete the authentication process (null for auth schemes that do not require redirection)

schema.description: Response schema for a refreshed connected account authentication

400.description: Bad request - Invalid nanoid format or the account cannot be refreshed in its current state

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication failed

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to refresh this connected account

404.description: Not found - Connected account does not exist or was deleted

500.description: Internal server error - Failed to refresh the connected account authentication

501.description: Not implemented - This operation is not supported for the requested connected account or authentication scheme

post.summary: Create a new tool router session (Legacy)
post.description: Creates a new session for the tool router lab feature (Legacy). This endpoint initializes a new session with specified toolkits and their authentication configurations. The session provides an isolated environment for testing and managing tool routing logic with scoped MCP server access.

user_id.description: Unique user identifier for the session owner

auth_config_id.description: Specific auth configuration ID for this toolkit

toolkits.description: Array of toolkit configurations with optional auth configs

config.description: Session configuration including enabled toolkits and their auth configs

201.description: Session successfully created. Returns the session ID and MCP server URL for the created session.

chat_session_mcp_url.description: MCP server endpoint URL for this specific chat session

tool_router_instance_mcp_url.description: MCP server endpoint URL for this specific tool router instance

400.description: Bad request. This may occur if the user_id format is invalid, toolkit names are invalid, or auth_config_id IDs are malformed.

409.description: Conflict. A session for this user with the same configuration already exists.

500.description: Internal server error. An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

post.summary: Create a new tool router session
post.description: Creates a new session for the tool router feature. This endpoint initializes a new session with specified toolkits and their authentication configurations. The session provides an isolated environment for testing and managing tool routing logic with scoped MCP server access.

user_id.description: The identifier of the user who is initiating the session, ideally a unique identifier from your database like a user ID or email address

enable.description: Only these specific toolkits will be enabled

disable.description: These specific toolkits will be disabled

toolkits.description: Toolkit configuration - specify either enable toolkits (allowlist) or disable toolkits (denylist). Mutually exclusive.

auth_configs.description: The auth configs to use for the session. This will override the default behavior and use the given auth config when specific toolkits are being executed

connected_accounts.description: The connected accounts to use for the session. This will override the default behaviour and use the given connected account when specific toolkits are being executed

enable.description: Whether to enable the connection manager for automatic connection handling. If true, we will provide a tool your agent can use to initiate connections to toolkits if it doesnt exist. If set to false, then you have to manage connections manually.

callback_url.description: The URL to redirect to after a user completes authentication for a connected account. This allows you to handle the auth callback in your own application.

enable.description: Only these specific tools will be available for this toolkit

disable.description: These specific tools will be disabled for this toolkit

enable.description: Tags that the tool must have at least one of

disable.description: Tags that the tool must NOT have any of

tags.description: MCP tags to filter tools. Array format is treated as enabled list. Object format supports both enabled and disabled lists.

tools.description: Tool-level configuration per toolkit - either specify enable tools (whitelist), disable tools (blacklist), or filter by MCP tags for each toolkit

enable.description: Tags that the tool must have at least one of

disable.description: Tags that the tool must NOT have any of

tags.description: Global MCP tool annotation hints for filtering. Array format is treated as enabled list. Object format supports both enabled (tool must have at least one) and disabled (tool must NOT have any) lists. Toolkit-level tags override this. Toolkit enabled/disabled lists take precedence over tag filtering.

enable_proxy_execution.description: Whether proxy execution is enabled. When enabled, workbench can call URLs and APIs directly.

auto_offload_threshold.description: Character threshold for automatic offloading. When workbench response exceeds this threshold, it will be automatically offloaded. Default is picked automatically based on the response size.

201.description: Session successfully created. Returns the session ID and MCP server URL for the created session.

type.description: The type of the MCP server. Can be http

url.description: The URL of the MCP server

tool_router_tools.description: List of available tools in this session

toolkits.description: Toolkit configuration - either enabled list or disabled list

enabled.description: Whether to enable the connection manager for automatic connection handling

callback_url.description: Custom callback URL for connected account auth flows

enabled.description: Tags that the tool must have at least one of

disabled.description: Tags that the tool must NOT have any of

enabled.description: Tags that the tool must have at least one of

disabled.description: Tags that the tool must NOT have any of

tags.description: MCP tool annotation hints for filtering tools with enabled/disabled support. enabled: tags that the tool must have at least one of. disabled: tags that the tool must NOT have any of. Both conditions must be satisfied.

proxy_execution_enabled.description: Whether proxy execution is enabled in the workbench

auto_offload_threshold.description: Character threshold after which tool execution response are saved to a file in workbench. Default is 20k.

config.description: The session configuration including user, toolkits, and overrides

400.description: Bad request. This may occur if the user_id format is invalid, toolkit names are invalid, or auth_config_id IDs are malformed.

401.description: Unauthorized. Authentication is required or the provided credentials are invalid.

403.description: Forbidden. The user is not authorized to create a tool router session.

500.description: Internal server error. An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

post.summary: Execute a tool within a tool router session
post.description: Executes a specific tool within a tool router session. The toolkit is automatically inferred from the tool slug. The tool must belong to an allowed toolkit and must not be disabled in the session configuration. This endpoint validates permissions, resolves connected accounts, and executes the tool with the session context.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the tool router session. Required for public API endpoints, optional for internal endpoints where it is injected by middleware.

parameters.description: Tool router session ID (required for public API, optional for internal - injected by middleware)
parameters.name: session_id

tool_slug.description: The unique slug identifier of the tool to execute

arguments.description: The arguments required by the tool

200.description: Successfully executed the tool. Returns execution result, logs, and status.

data.description: The data returned by the tool execution

error.description: Error message if the execution failed, null otherwise

log_id.description: Unique identifier for the execution log

400.description: Bad request

401.description: Unauthorized

403.description: Forbidden

404.description: Not found

500.description: Internal server error

schema.description: Filter toolkits by specific slugs (comma-separated). Overrides session toolkit configuration if provided.
